class.name: String
class.description: This is the built-in string class (and the one used by GDScript). It supports Unicode and provides all necessary means for string handling. Strings are reference counted and use a copy-on-write approach, so passing them around is cheap in resources.

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [bool].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [int].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [float].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [Vector2].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [Rect2].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [Vector3].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [Transform2D].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [Plane].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [Quat].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [AABB].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [Basis].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [Transform].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [Color].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [NodePath].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [RID].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [Dictionary].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [Array].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [PoolByteArray].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [PoolIntArray].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [PoolRealArray].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [PoolStringArray].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [PoolVector2Array].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [PoolVector3Array].

method.name: String
method.description: Constructs a new String from the given [PoolColorArray].

method.name: begins_with
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the string begins with the given string.

method.name: bigrams
method.description: Returns the bigrams (pairs of consecutive letters) of this string.

method.name: c_escape
method.description: Returns a copy of the string with special characters escaped using the C language standard.

method.name: c_unescape
method.description: Returns a copy of the string with escaped characters replaced by their meanings according to the C language standard.

method.name: capitalize
method.description: Changes the case of some letters. Replaces underscores with spaces, converts all letters to lowercase, then capitalizes first and every letter following the space character. For [code]capitalize camelCase mixed_with_underscores[/code] it will return [code]Capitalize Camelcase Mixed With Underscores[/code].

method.name: casecmp_to
method.description: Performs a case-sensitive comparison to another string. Returns [code]-1[/code] if less than, [code]+1[/code] if greater than, or [code]0[/code] if equal.

method.name: empty
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the string is empty.

method.name: ends_with
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the string ends with the given string.

method.name: erase
method.description: Erases [code]chars[/code] characters from the string starting from [code]position[/code].

method.name: find
method.description: Finds the first occurrence of a substring. Returns the starting position of the substring or -1 if not found. Optionally, the initial search index can be passed.

method.name: find_last
method.description: Finds the last occurrence of a substring. Returns the starting position of the substring or -1 if not found. Optionally, the initial search index can be passed.

method.name: findn
method.description: Finds the first occurrence of a substring, ignoring case. Returns the starting position of the substring or -1 if not found. Optionally, the initial search index can be passed.

method.name: format
method.description: Formats the string by replacing all occurences of [code]placeholder[/code] with [code]values[/code].

method.name: get_base_dir
method.description: If the string is a valid file path, returns the base directory name.

method.name: get_basename
method.description: If the string is a valid file path, returns the full file path without the extension.

method.name: get_extension
method.description: If the string is a valid file path, returns the extension.

method.name: get_file
method.description: If the string is a valid file path, returns the filename.

method.name: hash
method.description: Hashes the string and returns a 32-bit integer.

method.name: hex_to_int
method.description: Converts a string containing a hexadecimal number into an integer.

method.name: insert
method.description: Inserts a substring at a given position.

method.name: is_abs_path
method.description: If the string is a path to a file or directory, returns [code]true[/code] if the path is absolute.

method.name: is_rel_path
method.description: If the string is a path to a file or directory, returns [code]true[/code] if the path is relative.

method.name: is_subsequence_of
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this string is a subsequence of the given string.

method.name: is_subsequence_ofi
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this string is a subsequence of the given string, without considering case.

method.name: is_valid_float
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this string contains a valid float.

method.name: is_valid_html_color
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this string contains a valid color in HTML notation.

method.name: is_valid_identifier
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this string is a valid identifier. A valid identifier may contain only letters, digits and underscores (_) and the first character may not be a digit.

method.name: is_valid_integer
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this string contains a valid integer.

method.name: is_valid_ip_address
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this string contains a valid IP address.

method.name: json_escape
method.description: Returns a copy of the string with special characters escaped using the JSON standard.

method.name: left
method.description: Returns a number of characters from the left of the string.

method.name: length
method.description: Returns the string's amount of characters.

method.name: match
method.description: Does a simple expression match, where '*' matches zero or more arbitrary characters and '?' matches any single character except '.'.

method.name: matchn
method.description: Does a simple case insensitive expression match, using ? and * wildcards (see [method match]).

method.name: md5_buffer
method.description: Returns the MD5 hash of the string as an array of bytes.

method.name: md5_text
method.description: Returns the MD5 hash of the string as a string.

method.name: nocasecmp_to
method.description: Performs a case-insensitive comparison to another string. Returns [code]-1[/code] if less than, [code]+1[/code] if greater than, or [code]0[/code] if equal.

method.name: ord_at
method.description: Returns the character code at position [code]at[/code].

method.name: pad_decimals
method.description: Formats a number to have an exact number of [code]digits[/code] after the decimal point.

method.name: pad_zeros
method.description: Formats a number to have an exact number of [code]digits[/code] before the decimal point.

method.name: percent_decode
method.description: Decode a percent-encoded string. See [method percent_encode].

method.name: percent_encode
method.description: Percent-encodes a string. Encodes parameters in a URL when sending a HTTP GET request (and bodies of form-urlencoded POST requests).

method.name: plus_file
method.description: If the string is a path, this concatenates [code]file[/code] at the end of the string as a subpath. E.g. [code]"this/is".plus_file("path") == "this/is/path"[/code].

method.name: replace
method.description: Replaces occurrences of a substring with the given one inside the string.

method.name: replacen
method.description: Replaces occurrences of a substring with the given one inside the string. Ignores case.

method.name: rfind
method.description: Performs a search for a substring, but starts from the end of the string instead of the beginning.

method.name: rfindn
method.description: Performs a search for a substring, but starts from the end of the string instead of the beginning. Ignores case.

method.name: right
method.description: Returns the right side of the string from a given position.

method.name: sha256_text
method.description: Returns the SHA-256 hash of the string as a string.

method.name: similarity
method.description: Returns the similarity index of the text compared to this string. 1 means totally similar and 0 means totally dissimilar.

method.name: split
method.description: Splits the string by a divisor string and returns an array of the substrings. Example "One,Two,Three" will return ["One","Two","Three"] if split by ",". If [code]maxsplit[/code] is given, at most maxsplit number of splits occur, and the remainder of the string is returned as the final element of the list (thus, the list will have at most maxsplit+1 elements)

method.name: split_floats
method.description: Splits the string in floats by using a divisor string and returns an array of the substrings. Example "1,2.5,3" will return [1,2.5,3] if split by ",".

method.name: strip_edges
method.description: Returns a copy of the string stripped of any non-printable character at the beginning and the end. The optional arguments are used to toggle stripping on the left and right edges respectively.

method.name: substr
method.description: Returns part of the string from the position [code]from[/code] with length [code]len[/code].

method.name: to_ascii
method.description: Converts the String (which is a character array) to [PoolByteArray] (which is an array of bytes). The conversion is sped up in comparison to to_utf8() with the assumption that all the characters the String contains are only ASCII characters.

method.name: to_float
method.description: Converts a string containing a decimal number into a [code]float[/code].

method.name: to_int
method.description: Converts a string containing an integer number into an [code]int[/code].

method.name: to_lower
method.description: Returns the string converted to lowercase.

method.name: to_upper
method.description: Returns the string converted to uppercase.

method.name: to_utf8
method.description: Converts the String (which is an array of characters) to [PoolByteArray] (which is an array of bytes). The conversion is a bit slower than to_ascii(), but supports all UTF-8 characters. Therefore, you should prefer this function over to_ascii().

method.name: xml_escape
method.description: Returns a copy of the string with special characters escaped using the XML standard.

method.name: xml_unescape
method.description: Returns a copy of the string with escaped characters replaced by their meanings according to the XML standard.
